intro: Adinandra argentifolia, commonly known as silverleaf adenium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its silver-gray leaves and striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant is part of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed or open habitats. Adinandra argentifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been cultivated for its unique appearance.
